channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3268] Cat Plays with iPad. Awesomeness Ensues... (vid)
item.description: OK, maybe not awesomeness, but it's pretty funny -- cat plays with 'yarn' then, after mastering that, moves onto music with some pretty funny enjoyment of the piano...

item.title: [+2257] iPad printing: solved
[+1806] Miners can't attend funerals of their coworkers
item.description: Massey Energy told employees that if they miss work to attend the funerals they would be fired.

item.title: [+1688] Remember Google Wave? [Comic]
[+1633] Inside Of The Chinese Factory That Makes Microsoft Products
item.description: Over the past three years, unprecedented photographs of exhausted teenage workers, toiling and slumping asleep on their assembly line during break time, have been smuggled out of the KYE factory. "We are like prisoners... We do not have a life, only work."They make Microsoft mice, keyboards, webcams as well as other products.

item.title: [+1346] Shocker: Obama in dead heat with Ron Paul: Rasmussen poll
item.description: Ron Paul is a long-shot for the Republican nomination for president by any standard, but a Rasmussen poll finds him in a statistical tie with President Barack Obama.

item.title: [+1281] Don't Pick On These Geeks... (pic)
[+1197] 47% of Tea Partiers Pay No Federal Income Taxes
item.description: If the Tea Party movement has a similar share of Americans making under $50,000 as the broader population (as a recent Gallup poll suggests), then why is this movement rallying under the banner "Taxed Enough Already!" when half of them aren't taxed at all? Drink the Kool-aid, errâ€¦ tea & fall in line with the rhetoric. Teabaggers are hypocrites.

item.title: [+1142] 6 Million Resident SimCity. No Cheating.
item.description: The ultimate in armchair city planning.

item.title: [+1073] Homer Simpson Scolds Tiger
[+793] U.S. Military Report Says Massive Oil Shortages by 2015
item.description: The US military has warned that surplus oil production capacity could disappear within two years and there could be serious shortages by 2015 with a significant economic and political impact ... the cost of crude is predicted to soon top $100 a barrel.

item.title: [+780] Type O Negative Frontman Peter Steele Dead of Heart Failure
item.description: While nothing official has been released by the band or their management, is it believed that Type O Negative and Carnivore front man Peter Steele has died of heart failure. More details will be released as it comes.

item.title: [+720] Foods Gone Too Soon (Chart)
item.description: Five food fads that, sadly, didn't stand the test of time.

item.title: [+698] Ghost Towns: Places Abandoned Due To Disasters (PICS)
item.description: Disaster comes in differing dark shades of bleak and deadly flavors of horrendous dismay, such as environmental, economic, and natural. Across the globe, there are hundreds of ghost towns and places which were abandoned due to disasters.

item.title: [+670] Dogs: Not Down with the iPad [VIDEO]
item.description: Oh man, the "cute things + iPads" meme is revving up for real. First, came children with iPads, and then cats with iPads and now, inevitably, dogs with iPads. After watching this video, I would wager that cats are early adopters, while dogs are just more traditional. Pfft, he probably still has a landline, too.

item.title: [+657] Crazy Old Man Growls Like a Dog (Video)
item.description: This old man gets all excited and paints a perfect picture for you. If he had stayed and showed the dog this, he would of won the battle for sure.

item.title: [+642] Tea Party Supporters: Who They Are and What They Believe?
item.description: They're white. They're older. And they're angry.CBS News and the New York Times surveyed 1,580 adults, including 881 self-identified Tea Party supporters, to get a snapshot of the Tea Party movement. There is a lot of information to unpack; let's begin with the demographics.Eighteen percent of Americans identify as Tea Party supporters. The vast

item.title: [+604] 10 Things the Internet Has Killed or Ruined
item.description: From sex to Nigeria to arguments in bars to Chuck Norris: The Internet has badly affected them all (except Chuck Norris).

item.title: [+600] Modern Warfare (IW) team loses four more, nine this month
item.description: The mass exodus of Modern Warfare developer Infinity Ward team members continued today, as four more announced their resignations, according to reports. That list includes lead designers Steve Fukuda and Zied Reike, programmer Rayme Vinson and lead artist Chris Cherubini. Veteran programmer Jon Shiring & designer Mackey McCandlish left yesterday.

item.title: [+587] So Many Earthquakes! The End is Nigh! --
item.description: After China's quake, it's hard not to wonder -- is something crazy going on with Earth's crust?
